posts.message: Yesterday we were talking about image compression for front-end optimization. Today I found this study by Mozilla for better alternatives for JPG
posts.caption: people.mozilla.org
posts.description: This study compares the compression performance of four different image formats: JPEG, JPEG XR, WebP, and HEVC-MSP. The latter three formats were chosen because they are frequently discussed as possible JPEG successors.

posts.caption: coding.smashingmagazine.com
posts.description: In this article, Thierry Koblentz challenges CSS best practices and explains why he believes that the sacred principle of “separation of concerns” (SoC) has lead us to accept bloat, obsolescence, redundancy, poor caching and more.

posts.caption: onstartups.com
posts.description: A startup should be about solving a customer problem -- which does not always mean building a product from scratch.
